  • Nick

  • What is pair programming?

    Pair programming is a method to group with another person to work on a particular (coding) challenge. It's beneficial b/c it gets Two sets of eyes on a particular coding situation. Two thought-processes. Great to have another set of eyes backing you up, communicating. Etc. Other person might catch syntax issues.Getting to a better point at the end than one would have if they'd worked by themselves.

  • Why is pair programming important to DBC?

    DBC values culture aspect, but pragmatically, pair programming's...The collaborative aspect of pair programming facilitates faster learning. Culturally it helps talking to others and working in a collaborative environement b/c once out in the real world, will be working with other developers, and it's good to learn how to interface collaboratively.

  • Compare Driver and Navigator

    Driver writes the code based on navigator's direction. The navigator communicates the direction of the code and driver focuses on syntax.
